org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task

Class TaskState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task.CommonAttribute
      • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task.Task
        • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task.TaskState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<TaskState>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClientTaskState, TaskStateImpl, TaskStateImpl

    @PublicAPI
public abstract class TaskState
extends Task
implements Comparable<TaskState>
    This class contains all informations about the state of the task. It also provides methods and static fields to order the tasks if you hold them in a list.
    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 0.9
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getDependences

        public abstract List<TaskState> getDependences()
        To get the dependences of this task. Return null if this task has no dependence.
        Returns:
        the dependences of this task

      • getDependencesList

        public List<Task> getDependencesList()
        If the Task was submitted, a call to this method will throw a RuntimeException. The Dependence list should then be accessed through getDependences()
        Overrides:
        getDependencesList in class Task
        Returns:
        the the list of dependences of the task, or null if this task has been submitted

      • addDependence

        public void addDependence(Task task)
        If the Task was submitted, a call to this method will throw a RuntimeException. Dependences cannot be added to a task at runtime.
        Overrides:
        addDependence in class Task
        Parameters:
        task - the parent task to add to this task.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this task was already submitted to the scheduler

      • addDependences

        public void addDependences(List<Task> tasks)
        If the Task was submitted, a call to this method will throw a RuntimeException. Dependences cannot be added to a task at runtime.
        Overrides:
        addDependences in class Task
        Parameters:
        tasks - the parent tasks to add to this task.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this task was already submitted to the scheduler

      • getExecutionDuration

        public long getExecutionDuration()
        Get the real task duration in millis. It is the CPU time used by the task not including communication and initialization. It also include time spent in Pre and Post scripts.
        Returns:
        the real task duration in millis

      • replicate

        public abstract TaskState replicate()
                             throws Exception
        Replicates a task

        Deep copies all fields, does not share any reference

        Returns:
        the newly created task, cast as a TaskState
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getIterationIndex

        public abstract int getIterationIndex()
        When Control Flow actions are performed (see Task.getFlowScript()), some tasks are replicated. A task replicated by a FlowActionType.LOOP action is differentiated from the original by an incremented Iteration Index.
        Returns:
        the iteration number of this task if it was replicated by a LOOP flow operation (>= 0)

      • getReplicationIndex

        public abstract int getReplicationIndex()
        When Control Flow actions are performed (see Task.getFlowScript()), some tasks are replicated. A task replicated by a FlowActionType.REPLICATE action is differentiated from the original by an incremented Replication Index.
        Returns:
        the replication number of this task if it was replicated by a REPLICATE flow operations (>= 0)

      • getScopeVariables

        public Map<String,Serializable> getScopeVariables()
        Returns a map containing all scope variables defined in this Task (i.e. all task variables not inherited)
        Returns:
        map of variables

      • getSystemVariables

        public Map<String,Serializable> getSystemVariables()
        Returns a map containing all variables defined by the system for this task, such as PA_JOB_ID, PA_USER, etc.
        Returns:
        map of variables

      • getRuntimeVariables

        public Map<String,Serializable> getRuntimeVariables()
        Returns a map containing both scope variables and system variables
        Returns:
        map of variables

      • getRuntimeGenericInformation

        public Map<String,String> getRuntimeGenericInformation()
        Returns a map of generic information, with replacement done from the runtime variables map
